bibl.title: Letter Carriers in the Ancient Jewish Epistolary Material.

series.title: Studies in Scripture in Early Judaism and Christianity.

bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Manuscript letters. [makes use of the Greek epistolary material] - 3. Letters preserved within the Rabbinic traditions. - 4. Letters cited in the Maccabean literature (1 and 2 Maccabees). - 5. Letters cited in Josephus' works. - 6. Letters in Philo's works. - 7. Conclusion.

bibl.title: Jewish and Christian Scripture as Artifact and Canon

bibl.seg: Head Peter M., Letter Carriers in the Ancient Jewish Epistolary Material.

Craig A. Evans and H. Daniel Zacharias (Edd.), Jewish and Christian Scripture as Artifact and Canon = Studies in Scripture in Early Judaism and Christianity. 13 = Library of Second Temple Studies. 70 (London, 2009) pp. 203-219.

1. Introduction. - 2. Manuscript letters. [makes use of the Greek epistolary material] - 3. Letters preserved within the Rabbinic traditions. - 4. Letters cited in the Maccabean literature (1 and 2 Maccabees). - 5. Letters cited in Josephus' works. - 6. Letters in Philo's works. - 7. Conclusion.
